title: How to Play Blitzcrank

steps.headline: Starting out, grab Faerie Charm, Rejuvenation Bead, wards, and some health potions.
steps.description: While Blitzcrank may not be super mana hungry, his passive, mana shield, scales off his current mana, rather then his total mana.

steps.headline: Take Blitzcrank's Q first.
steps.description: It is a grab that fires in a straight line, and grabs any enemy, pulling them back toward you. When it reaches you, the enemy is stunned for a short amount of time.

steps.headline: Begin to farm the minions.
steps.description: Take care not to get to close to the enemy, as at early levels, Blitzcrank is rather weak. Rather, you can grab a few minions to intimidate the enemy. Don't let the enemy take your turret just yet. Grab Blitzcrank's W at level 2. It is an attack speed and movement speed buff. Then at level 3, grab E. It is a punch that knocks the enemy into the air and stuns them. Retreat back to spawn.

steps.headline: Start to build Manamune and Frozen heart, as the mana buffs for both items are substantial.
steps.description: If you have trouble getting gold, Aegis of the Legion. It is a cheap substitute for Guardian Angel.

steps.headline: Go back to lane and farm some more.
steps.description: Stay in the bush with your teammate. Then, when everyone forgets you two are there, grab the champion and kill him/her. It's an easy way to get a few assists.

steps.headline: At level 4, get W again, level five, get Q, and at level six, get Blizcrank's ultimate.
steps.description: Blitzcrank's ultimate is a shock field that strikes every 2.5 seconds. When active, is hits everything is a region around Blitzcrank, silencing them.

steps.headline: Go back to spawn, and get Mikael's Crucible.
steps.description: If you have left over gold, begin building toward mercury boots.

steps.headline: Go back to lane and farm some more.
steps.description: At level seven, get W, and at level eight, get Q.

steps.headline: Blizcrank is great for starting team fights.
steps.description: Blitzcrank has a high defense coupled with his mana shield. To start a fight, go to mid and signal the jungler to do the same. Then jump out of jungle and grab the enemy. You will almost always be hit by the rest of the enemy team. Use the ultimate and begin running. Your health will begin to deteriorate rapidly. At 20%, your mana shield will pop up. Right before your mana shield activates, use your Manamune. This particular item will boost your mana to almost full. Continue running while your team takes care of the enemy.

steps.headline: Proceed to harass the enemy by pulling minions and monsters.
Build a little attack damage, but mostly defense, mana, and cooldown.
Your team has begun to push for the game.
steps.description: Now, when you pull someone, don't worry about killing them. Leave them there and attack the turret.

steps.headline: Near the end, begin to focus less on grabbing champions and more on jungle monsters.
steps.description: If you see the enemy jungler stealing your dragon, grab the dragon and beat it up. Then, grab the enemy and beat them up!

text: Levels 1 to 8 Starting out, grab Faerie Charm, Rejuvenation Bead, wards, and some health potions. While Blitzcrank may not be super mana hungry, his passive, mana shield, scales off his current mana, rather then his total mana. Take Blitzcrank's Q first. It is a grab that fires in a straight line, and grabs any enemy, pulling them back toward you. When it reaches you, the enemy is stunned for a short amount of time. Begin to farm the minions. Take care not to get to close to the enemy, as at early levels, Blitzcrank is rather weak. Rather, you can grab a few minions to intimidate the enemy. Don't let the enemy take your turret just yet. Grab Blitzcrank's W at level 2. It is an attack speed and movement speed buff. Then at level 3, grab E. It is a punch that knocks the enemy into the air and stuns them. Retreat back to spawn. Start to build Manamune and Frozen heart, as the mana buffs for both items are substantial. If you have trouble getting gold, Aegis of the Legion. It is a cheap substitute for Guardian Angel. Go back to lane and farm some more. Stay in the bush with your teammate. Then, when everyone forgets you two are there, grab the champion and kill him/her. It's an easy way to get a few assists. At level 4, get W again, level five, get Q, and at level six, get Blizcrank's ultimate. Blitzcrank's ultimate is a shock field that strikes every 2.5 seconds. When active, is hits everything is a region around Blitzcrank, silencing them. Go back to spawn, and get Mikael's Crucible. If you have left over gold, begin building toward mercury boots. Go back to lane and farm some more. At level seven, get W, and at level eight, get Q. Team Fights Blizcrank is great for starting team fights. Blitzcrank has a high defense coupled with his mana shield. To start a fight, go to mid and signal the jungler to do the same. Then jump out of jungle and grab the enemy. You will almost always be hit by the rest of the enemy team. Use the ultimate and begin running. Your health will begin to deteriorate rapidly. At 20%, your mana shield will pop up. Right before your mana shield activates, use your Manamune. This particular item will boost your mana to almost full. Continue running while your team takes care of the enemy. Proceed to harass the enemy by pulling minions and monsters.  Build a little attack damage, but mostly defense, mana, and cooldown.  Pushing Phase Your team has begun to push for the game. Now, when you pull someone, don't worry about killing them. Leave them there and attack the turret. Near the end, begin to focus less on grabbing champions and more on jungle monsters. If you see the enemy jungler stealing your dragon, grab the dragon and beat it up. Then, grab the enemy and beat them up!
